result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvaro Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $550 has been applied. Remaining fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.   Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

Defendant's driving abstract given to the Court by ADA Anderson at the March 8, 2016 Initial Appearance/Plea-sentencing hearing
from DA's Office with attached blood draw reimbursement request - $42.50

15CM484 & 16CM86 Cases called @ 3:03 p.m. Defendant Alvaro Hernandez in court. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM86 -   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Complaint given to the defendant by ADA Anderson. The Court reads the complaint to the defendant.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel and wishes to enter a plea on all pending cases. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: 15CM484: Ct 1 - Guilty. 16CM86: Ct 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 16CM86: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. 15TR3244, 15TR3245, 16TR558 & 16TR577 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. No statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM484 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. 16CM86 - 28 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 3/15/2016, $1618 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 blood draw costs, 16 mo DL revocation/16 mo IID, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied. Spanish appeal rights given.

Search Warrant (phone) and Warrant Application CD
Return of Operating While Impaired Warrant
